---
name: global-validation
description: Validate user input and data following security best practices with server-side validation, proper error messages, and protection against injection attacks. Use this skill when validating form or API input, implementing serializer validation in DRF, writing model clean() methods, sanitizing user input, implementing business rule validation, creating custom validators, or ensuring consistent validation across API endpoints and background jobs.
---

## When to use this skill:

- When validating user input in API serializers
- When implementing validate_<field> methods in DRF serializers
- When writing object-level validation with validate() method
- When implementing model validation with clean() method
- When sanitizing user input to prevent injection attacks
- When validating data types, formats, and required fields
- When implementing business rule validation in services
- When creating custom field validators
- When ensuring validation consistency across API endpoints
- When providing clear, field-specific error messages
- When validating data in background jobs or management commands
- When implementing allowlist validation over blocklist
- When protecting against SQL injection, XSS, or command injection

# Global Validation

This Skill provides Claude Code with specific guidance on how to adhere to coding standards as they relate to how it should handle global validation.

## Instructions

For details, refer to the information provided in this file:
[global validation](../../../agent-os/standards/global/validation.md)
